articles.author: JULIA FRANKEL and ABBY SEWELL
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Hamas confirmed Friday that its leader, Yahya Sinwar, was killed by Israeli forces in Gaza and reiterated its stance that hostages the militant group took from Israel a year ago will not be released until there is a cease-fire in Gaza and a withdrawal of Israeli troops.
articles.title: Israel and Hamas signal they are no closer to ending Gaza war after Sinwar's death

articles.author: BASSEM MROUE
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Yahya Sinwar, Hamas’ top leader and a mastermind of the Oct.
articles.title: Yahya Sinwar, Hamas' top leader and a mastermind of the Oct. 7 attack on Israel, is dead at 61

articles.author: CHRIS MEGERIAN
articles.description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich. (AP) — Kamala Harris and Donald Trump will both be scouring for votes in Michigan on Friday as they try to lock down support in this key political battleground.
articles.title: Harris and Trump target Michigan as both parties try to shore up 'blue wall' votes

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: This year has seen President Vladimir Putin repeatedly brandish the nuclear sword, reminding everyone that Russia has the world’s largest atomic arsenal to try to deter the West from ramping up support for Ukraine.
articles.title: Russia flaunts its many doomsday weapons to keep the West from ramping up support for Ukraine

articles.author: ALAN SUDERMAN and GARANCE BURKE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Kremlin could not have asked for better publicity at a better time when Ben Swann, a self-described independent journalist who promotes conspiracy theories, released a 12-part video series he promised would reveal dark truths about Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.
articles.title: Right-wing influencers hyped anti-Ukraine videos made by a TV producer also funded by Russian media

articles.author: HYUNG-JIN KIM and KIM TONG-HYUNG
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — South Korea's spy agency said Friday that North Korea has dispatched troops to support Russia's war against Ukraine.
articles.title: South Korean intelligence says North has sent troops to aid Russia's war in Ukraine

articles.author: ISABELLA VOLMERT and MICHELLE R. SMITH
articles.description: Christian nationalist leaders are telling followers that Vice President Kamala Harris is under the influence of a “Jezebel spirit,” using a term with deeply racist and misogynistic roots that is setting off alarm bells for religious and political scholars.
articles.title: What's a 'Jezebel spirit'? Some Christians use the term to paint Kamala Harris with a demonic brush

articles.author: RICK CALLAHAN
articles.description: DELPHI, Ind. (AP) — Jurors heard opening statements Friday in the trial of a man accused of killing two teen girls in a small Indiana community, horrific deaths that went unsolved for five years before investigators arrested a pharmacy employee who lived in the same town.
articles.title: A murder trial begins in a small Indiana town in the killings of two teenage girls

articles.author: TOM KRISHER
articles.description: DETROIT (AP) — The U.S. government's road safety agency is investigating Tesla's “Full Self-Driving” system after getting reports of crashes in low-visibility conditions, including one that killed a pedestrian.
articles.title: US to probe Tesla's 'Full Self-Driving' system after pedestrian killed in low visibility conditions

articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Friends, collaborators and fellow musicians have expressed shock and sadness over the death of former One Direction singer Liam Payne, who died in Buenos Aires, Argentina Wednesday at age 31.
articles.title: Liam Payne’s 1D bandmates, James Corden and more friends and musicians mourn singer
